dc:title: Hunger Marchers in Washington
dc:creator: Dorothy Day
dc:description: Narrates the events surrounding a workers protest march in Washington, D.C., organized by the Communists. Contrasts the press-fed frenzy of the authorities with the well-planned, disciplined, and non-violent demonstrators.
dc:identifier: Dorothy Day Library on the Web document 39 1932-12-24 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday
